verses.roman:
pakṣī, mṛga, vṛkṣa, latā, cetanācetana
preme matta kari' ākarṣaye kṛṣṇa-guṇa

synonyms: pakṣī—birds; mṛga—animals; vṛkṣa—trees; latā—creepers; cetana-acetana—living entities and even the stones and wood; preme—in ecstatic love; matta—captivated; kari'-making; ākarṣaye—attract; kṛṣṇa-guṇa—the qualities of Kṛṣṇa.
translation: "The qualities of Kṛṣṇa captivate and attract everything, living and dead. Even birds, animals and trees are attracted to Kṛṣṇa's qualities.
